lead_paragraph: Carol Dauplaise, a jewelry designer who was crossing the street at Madison Avenue and 36th Street, was the fourth pedestrian killed by a motor vehicle in New York City in the past three days.

byline.contributor: Marc Santora contributed reporting, and Alain Delaquérière contributed research.

headline.print_headline: Woman, 77, Fatally Struck by Livery Cab in Midtown Manhattan
headline.main: Woman, 77, Fatally Struck by Livery Cab in Midtown

snippet: Carol Dauplaise, a jewelry designer who was crossing the street at Madison Avenue and 36th Street, was the fourth pedestrian killed by a motor vehicle in New York City in the past three days.
abstract: Livery cab strikes 77-year-old Carol Dauplaise in Midtown Manhattan, pinning her underneath; Dauplaise later dies, and driver is charged with failing to yield to pedestrian; Dauplaise is fourth person hit and killed by motor vehicle in past three days in New York City, despite overall decline in such deaths under de Blasio administration's Vision Zero plan to eliminate all traffic fatalities by 2024.
